If you are a legal resident of the state you are living in go to the Health and Human Services people and they can steer you in the right direction. Family welfare will also be a place to look and children's services as well. I have some fair experience counselling people about these matters and in other areas as well. Go to my profile click on the friends thing and you can e-mail if you wish it's a blind service and you can't find me and I can't find you!! content: Military One Source is the place to start. There is free counseling, information, etc.. and it is confidential. Be prepared that if you do get a divorce that the military will not move you back home, unless the AD member agrees to use his final HOR move which doesnt happen often. So it can be up to you to do so. Save your money, get rid of stuff, etc....put money in your bank account and it goes from there, so that way you are slightly protected.
